1000: Hello, %pcn, you need a job? If you were available for a little guard duty you could earn yourself some goldpieces tonight. One of the local nobles has invited friends for a feast, and they need someone to guard the valuables, including the pretty ladies! Are you available tonight, %pcf?
%pcn! Would you be available to play the bouncer at _partyhouse_ tonight? Pay is the usual, you might meet some interesting people there! You want the job?
Hey I have an easy job for you, %pcf! There is a some sort of celebration going on tonight, and they need someone to keep watch at the door. That's easy money, don't you think? For =gold_ goldpieces?
1001: No? I should have mentioned that there is free beer for guards after duty, I guess.
1002: Ok. The party starts at 18:00 tonight, and you are expected there no later! Talk to _partyman_, %g will explain your duties. The venue is _partyhouse_.
You will do it? Great! Go to _partyhouse_ at 6pm to meet _partyman_, he will give you instructions. Not that the job is very complicated...
1004: Some trouble at the party, I heard? Well, good that they had a professional guard from the fighters guild!
1005: There is a great party at _partyhouse_ tonight, but I am not invited
A lot of rich people came along the main road yesterday, they are  going to _partyman_'s celebration.
All __partyhouse_ is in uproar, because of _partyman_s party!
1006: There was a terrible riot at _partyman_s party.
_partyman_ is angry with the fighters guild, because they could notprotect his celebration.
1007: It was a great party at _partyhouse_, I hear.
You were at the party! Tell me, did you see  _partyman_? He is incredibly famous.
1008: You helped us to improve our standing with  _partyman_. What may I do for you?
1009: That party didn't work out quite the way it was planned, right, %pcf?
1010: ___qgiver_, %qdt: I was hired as a guard for a party at  _partyhouse_ by _qgiver_ of the fighters guild. I should be there at 6pm tonight  and talk to _partyman_  who will explain my duties.
1011: _partyman_ approaches you: Not a very exiting party! Everybody left already! Well thank you for keeping an eye on things. _qgiver_ will pay you and I will recommend you to my friends.
_partyman_ approaches you: Well I had a great evening! Not the least thanks to your watchfulness, %pcf. Well done!
1012: Ah the guard has arrived! Well, you know how this works, right? If any aggressive do no goods show up, You ask them to leave. If they dont leave you throw them out, if you cant throw them out, use your weapon.
So you are the bouncer? Well get over there and watch the door. Don't let anyone in that does not have an invitation! And don't let me catch you being rough with my guests!
1013: _partyman_ yells at you: Cant you deal with such things swiftly and quietly, %oth! Now all my friends have fled _partyhouse_. I will not pay for such an amateurish guard!
1014: In fact I was impressed with the way you fulfilled Your duty. Take this ring and buy yourself a drink!
1015: You missed your assignment at _partyhouse_. _qgiver_ will not be pleased about this.
1020: I have to bring _guest_ to  _hospital_.It seems %g is very sick, I have to hurry!
1050: Gettouttada way... Where whereiss... Whereiss m' free beer? You stole my beer!
Halt, halt, halt! Thats what they always yell. You are one of those right? Well you cant stop me from having some fun!
1051: Damn, they hired a guard! I am sorry, but if you dont want to let me go, I will have to cut your throat. - Are you letting the thief flee?
1052: You wanna stop me? YOU wanna stop me??? I come all this way to _partyhouse_ for some fun and now YOU WANNA STOP ME? That's a bad idea, stupid!
1055: The old monk screams in pain. "Hey, that was just a misunderstanding, I didn't mean no harm! Please, let an old beggarman stay here and beg, Its doing no one no harm."
1056: Thank you so much! May %god bless you! I will just stay there in the shadows and remain out of your sights, good lord.
1057: No? well, I will make you feel the wrath of %god, you imbecile!
1058: _partyman_ approaches you, looking quite distraught. %pcf, one of the guest, _guest_, has collpsed! Probably just too much drink, but %g looks all pale. Would you carry %g2 to _hospital_? I would be very grateful if you could. I think none of us is strong enough to carry %g2 all the way. Hurry, %pcf!

Suddenly you notice that one of the guests is in trouble. _guest_ suddenly starts to sway and falls to his knees moments later. As you bend down to him he grabs your sleeve. "I ate too much of those mushrooms from Morrowind... Please help me! I cant breathe!" The host, _partyman_ looks at the fainting figure and than at you: "Quick! get him to _hospital_!"
1059: You wont? I will remember that.
1060: One of the priest takes _guest_ out of your arms. "Whatever %g took it was strong stuff, too strong for %g2 it seems. And too much wine on top of it! Well, I believe we will be able to heal %g2."
1061: _guest_s breath comes in gasps and %g3 eyes glaze over. Suddenly %g shudders and falls silent. _guest_ is dead. _partyman_ steps up behind you. "%oth. Well the party is over, I guess. You can go home now, %pcf. I wish you could have run faster and we might have made it."
1063: Right behind you _partyman_ enters. After a brief discussion with the priest. %g turns to you. "I am indeed grateful for your help, %pcn. I hope I can count on your discretion too. Take this as gold as payment for your troubles, and this gem for saving the life of a friend, I hope our paths will cross again, %pcf."
